intro: Catenulina, commonly known as the catenulina plant, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. It is characterized by its umbellate inflorescences, which are clusters of small, white or yellow flowers. The leaves are usually finely divided and aromatic, similar to other members of its family. The plant is native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and pleasant fragrance.
